byline.contributor: Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Gui Minhai, co-owner of a Hong Kong publishing company that put out salacious works about mainland leaders, is accused in a fatal drunken-driving case from 2003.

headline.print_headline: Missing Man Back in China, Confessing to Fatal Crime
headline.main: Missing Man Back in China, Confessing to Fatal Crime

snippet: Gui Minhai, co-owner of a Hong Kong publishing company that put out salacious works about mainland leaders, is accused in a fatal drunken-driving case from 2003.
abstract: Gui Minhai, Hong Kong publisher and naturalized Swedish citizen who disappeared after reportedly violating his probation in drunk driving accident, reappears in China to confess to crime; says he returned to China voluntarily to face justice; is among five Mighty Current Media employees who disappeared; company publishes books highlighting sex lives and corruption of Chinese officials.
